There is no documentation that the contingency plan has been reviewed by the exhibitor in the past year. Failure to
regularly review the contingency plan may result in out-of-date information, delays in emergency response and
subsequent injury to animals. The plan must be reviewed by the exhibitor on at least an annual basis to ensure that it
adequately addresses the criteria listed in paragraph (a) of this section. Each licensee must maintain documentation of
their annual reviews, including documenting any amendments or changes made to their plan since the previous year's
review. Review documentation must be made available to APHIS upon request.
Correct by 28 August 2024.

There is rust present throughout the interior surfaces of the outdoor primary enclosure for chickens. There is significant
reddish rusting and flaking of the metal posts of the frame and of a corrugated metal sheet inside of the enclosure. Rusty
surfaces cannot be effectively cleaned and sanitized. Any surfaces that come into contact with birds must be free of
excessive rust that prevents the required cleaning and sanitization, or that affects the structural strength of the surface.
Correct by 12 August 2024.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
A developed and documented environment enhancement plan for birds was not available for review at time of inspection.
Failure to create and follow an environment enhancement plan can lead to poor health and psychological welfare of birds.
A species-appropriate plan for environment enhancement is required to be developed, documented and followed in order
to promote the psychological well-being of birds. This plan must be approved by the attending veterinarian.
Correct by 28 August 2024.

At time of inspection, two water receptacles in the outdoor primary enclosure for chickens had greenish-brown organic
sediment covering the bottom and sides of the receptacles. The water had a brownish color. The facility representative
stated the water receptacles had not been cleaned or sanitized for a while. Failure to provide access to potable water in
clean water receptacles for animals may result in their illness or injury. Exhibitors shall keep all water receptacles clean
and sanitary. Corrected at time of inspection.
Correct from this date forward of 29 July 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
